articles.author: Adam Pengilly
articles.title: ‘It was his life and his love’: Bob Shearer, who fleeced Jack Nicklaus on his own course, dies - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Up until his death of a heart attack on Sunday morning, Shearer would still play golf three or four times a week. But it was the memory of a vintage Australian Open which will linger longest.
articles.content: There was a time in golf when Jack Nicklaus had been the worlds best for 20 years, and under the shadows of a clubhouse burnt to the ground a few weeks beforehand, headlined the Australian Open in 19… [+2069 chars]
